meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The old car engine was cackling loudly.
meanings.sent2: The witch was cackling with glee as she brewed her potion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was cackling as it stole nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The fire crackled and cackled in the fireplace, warming the room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm cackled ominously in the distance.

meanings.definition: A loud, shrill laugh or chatter
meanings.sent1: The cackling of the hyenas echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: Her cackling could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent3: The children's cackling filled the playground with joy.
meanings.sent4: The cackling of the magpies disrupted the peaceful morning.
meanings.sent5: The witch's cackling sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: A series of sharp, high-pitched vocal sounds
meanings.sent1: The cackling of the geese signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: The cackling of the hens woke up the whole farm.
meanings.sent3: The cackling of the ducks made the pond feel alive.
meanings.sent4: The cackling of the seagulls accompanied the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The cackling of the parrots brightened up the pet store.
